avalancheActivity.comment: One small avalanche fell on Ingólfsfjöll and another on Hafnarfjall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: A high rate of snow melt is expected on Friday and Saturday and wet avalanches may fall.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Significant melting is expected in the warm temperatures and rain on Friday and Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM. A significant amount of rain is forecasted in these areas as well as the South, Southeast and Snæfellsnes but thawing is expected in all parts and wet avalanches , slush flows, landslides and rock fall are expected to be widespread. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rock can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hlýtt í veðri og rigning á föstudag og laugardag. Éljagangi til fjalla í breytilegum vindáttum á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.comment: Earlier this week, many small avalanches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð, Kirkjubólshlið, Súgundafjörður and Naustahvilft following snowfall.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs especially on N to NW-facing slopes are likely to form with new snow fall and strong winds. Wet avalanches can fall in melting on Saturday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are likely to form especially on N to NW-facing slopes due to new snow fall and strong winds on Friday. Considerable accumulation can be expected especially in gullies and depressions. Significant melting is expected in the warm temperatures on Saturday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM. A significant amount of rain is forecasted in these areas as well as the South, Southeast and Snæfellsnes but thawing is expected in all parts and wet avalanches , slush flows, landslides and rock fall are expected to be widespread. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rock can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðaustan stormur og snjókomu á föstudag. Hlýtt og rigning á laugardag, líka til fjalla. Kólnandi og rólegra á sunnudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs are  most likely present. Rising temperatures on Saturday with increased risk of wet avalanches.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Increasing avalanche danger on Friday with rising temperatures. Becoming even warmer on Saturday with increased risk of wet avalanches.  Wind slabs are present  probably on most aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM. A significant amount of rain is forecasted in these areas as well as the South, Southeast and Snæfellsnes but thawing is expected in all parts and wet avalanches , slush flows, landslides and rock fall are expected to be widespread. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rock can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM.

weatherForecast.highlights: Dálítið breytilegar áttir næstu daga en þó aðallega hvassar S-lægar áttir og líkur á dálítilli snjókomu á sunnudag. Hlýnar talsvert á laugardag og hlánar upp í fjallstoppa um tíma.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches released in the new snow at the beginning of the week. Many avalances released during heavy precipitation at the beginning of last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Chances of wet avalanches during thaw over the weekend. Wind slabs could be present on most aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed in the mountains the night before Friday. Thaw the night before Saturday with rain and increased risk of wet avalanches. Wind slabs are widely in the mountains and could be on most aspects. Considerable snow is in gullies. A snowpit from Oddsskarð on Jan 29 shows a layered snowpack, which fractured at 10 cm with moderate loading.

travelAdvisory.comment: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM. A significant amount of rain is forecasted in these areas as well as the South, Southeast and Snæfellsnes but thawing is expected in all parts and wet avalanches , slush flows, landslides and rock fall are expected to be widespread. Travelers are encouraged to show care in places where rock can fall and close to streams and pathways where slush flows can occur.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Uncertainty phase due to risk of mass movements applies in southern Westfjords from 4 PM and in the southern part of the Eastfjords from 8 PM.

weatherForecast.highlights: Snjókoma aðfaranótt föstudags. Vaxandi S-SA-átt er líður á föstudaginn, hlýnandi veður og úrkoma um kvöldið, fyrst snjókoma til fjalla og rigning á láglendi en aðfaranótt laugardags hlýnar með rigningu upp í fjallstoppa. Á sunnudag er útlit fyrir talsverða rigningu um kvöldið.
